titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Investment Committee, Yale University, Records of Meetings
Investment Committee, Yale University, Records of Meetings
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 26, 2019 at 07:14

did.unittitle: Investment Committee, Yale University, records of meetings

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of meeting agendas and minutes, reports, and materials of the Investment Committee maintained by the Yale Investment Office.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 5-D (YRG 5-D), Investment and insurance records of Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Investment Committee, Yale University, Records of Meetings (RU 297). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of meeting agendas and minutes, reports, and materials of the Investment Committee maintained by the Yale Investment Office.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

controlaccess.subject: Investments
Universities and colleges -- Finance
controlaccess.corpname: Yale University. Office of Finance and Administration

did.unittitle: Minutes, agendas, and reports of the Investment Committee [computer files]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For the most part, each file on the CDs represents either a quarterly mailing or annual report from the Investment Office to the Investment Committee for the period 1975 to March 2000. These mailings have followed a standard format since 1985, and the pdf files covering these years are exact copies of the original documents. The material prior to 1985 has been recreated from incomplete records as best as we were able to follow the format of the later reports; this revision is noted on the title page of the early-period documents. There are a couple of additional files that represent interim mailings to the Committee and special reports on Endowment investment performance.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
